alert.note: Alert for Broadwater; Jefferson; Lewis and Clark (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 27 at 3:55PM MST until November 27 at 4:30PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Lewis and Clark County in west central Montana... West central Broadwater County in southwestern Montana... Northern Jefferson County in southwestern Montana... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 355 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 14 miles east of Montana City to 10 miles northeast of Basin, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Trained spotter. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Townsend, Boulder, Basin, Wickes, Winston, Alhambra, Elk Park, Corbin, Silos, Clancy, Jefferson City and Elkhorn State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
